conversation.text: Hi the first step when making Christmas muffins is to preheat the oven and line a muffin tin.
evidence: Preheat the oven to 355 °F (179 °C) and line a muffin tin.

conversation.text: Alright what level of heat must I apply when preheating?
Get out a muffin tin with 12 holes and put liners into each hole. in the case of not using any muffin liners simply spray the muffin tin with baking spray and set aside.
evidence: Get out a 12-hole muffin tin and put muffin liners into each cavity. If you don't want to use muffin liners, you can spray the inside of the tin with baking spray. Set the pan aside while you prepare the muffin batter.

conversation.text: You will need, 3/4 cups of butter and brown sugar, 3 eggs, 1 2/3 cups of self rising flour. 1/2 teaspoon of salt, baking powder, ground cinnamon, ground cloves, coriander.
evidence: Place 3/4 cup (175 g) of softened butter into a large mixing bowl along with 3/4 cup (175 g) of brown sugar, 3 eggs, 1 2/3 cups (175 g) of self-rising flour, 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 g) of salt, 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 g) of baking powder, and 2 tablespoons (15 g) of ground mixed spice.Homemade Mixed Spice:1/2 tablespoon (3 g) of ground cinnamon1 teaspoon (2 g) of ground allspice1 teaspoon (2 g) of ground nutmeg1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of ground cloves1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of ground ginger1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of ground coriander1/4 teaspoon of (0.5 g) of ground mace

conversation.text: Wow that is a lot, do I mix it all in one bowl?
Yes, put all the ingredients in one bowl and mix it all up.
evidence: Put the butter, sugar, eggs, flour, baking powder, and spices in a bowl

conversation.text: Okay awesome, are there any other ingredients that we should add?
Throw in some dried mixed fruit, Brandy and orange juice and use a spatula to gently fold in the fruit and the liquid.
evidence: Fold in the dried mixed fruit and brandy or orange juice.

conversation.text: How do I know that I am ready to place in oven?
When the batter has reached a soft and fluffy consistency divide it into the tin, place in oven and bake for 25-30 minutes.
evidence: Divide the batter in the tin and bake the muffins for 25 to 30 minutes.

conversation.text: All done, thank you they are so fluffy and smell so delicious, everyone in the house is talking about them.
I am happy that it all turned out well for you, remember to cool the muffins before covering them with icing.
evidence: It's important to cool the muffins before covering them with icing.

procedure.summary: Preheat the oven to 355 °F (179 °C) and line a muffin tin.
procedure.description: Get out a 12-hole muffin tin and put muffin liners into each cavity. If you don't want to use muffin liners, you can spray the inside of the tin with baking spray. Set the pan aside while you prepare the muffin batter.

procedure.summary: Put the butter, sugar, eggs, flour, baking powder, and spices in a bowl.
procedure.description: Place 3/4 cup (175 g) of softened butter into a large mixing bowl along with 3/4 cup (175 g) of brown sugar, 3 eggs, 1 2/3 cups (175 g) of self-rising flour, 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 g) of salt, 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 g) of baking powder, and 2 tablespoons (15 g) of ground mixed spice.Homemade Mixed Spice:1/2 tablespoon (3 g) of ground cinnamon1 teaspoon (2 g) of ground allspice1 teaspoon (2 g) of ground nutmeg1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of ground cloves1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of ground ginger1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of ground coriander1/4 teaspoon of (0.5 g) of ground mace

procedure.summary: Beat the ingredients in the mixing bowl for 3 to 4 minutes.
procedure.description: Use a stand or hand mixer to combine the ingredients on medium speed. Keep beating until the mixture is pale and creamy. You may need to stop and scrape down the sides of the bowl occasionally. If you prefer to beat the mixture by hand, use a wooden spoon and beat the mixture for 5 to 6 minutes.

procedure.summary: Fold in the dried mixed fruit and brandy or orange juice.
procedure.description: Add 2/3 cup (115 g) of mixed dried fruit and 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of brandy or orange juice to the batter in the mixing bowl. Use a spatula to fold in the fruit and liquid until they're incorporated. To fold, use a twisting motion with your wrist to bring the batter up and over the fruit. Keep doing this gently to keep as much air in the batter as possible. This will make the muffins light.

procedure.summary: Divide the batter in the tin and bake the muffins for 25 to 30 minutes.
procedure.description: Use a cookie scoop or large spoon to scoop the batter into the prepared muffin tin. The batter should fill all 12 muffin cavities. Then put the tin in the preheated oven and bake the muffins until they're cooked throughout. To test if the muffins are done, insert a toothpick or skewer into the center of a muffin. The muffins are finished if the tester comes out clean. If not, bake the muffins for another 2 minutes and check again.

Remove the tin from the oven and let the muffins cool for 5 minutes in the tin. Then turn them out onto a wire rack and leave them until they're completely cooled. Then you can ice or decorate the muffins.Did You Know? It's important to cool the muffins before covering them with icing. If you spread icing on warm muffins, the icing will slide off or the muffins will absorb it. If you store the muffins ahead of time, wait to put the decorations on the icing or they could discolor it. Store the leftover muffins in an airtight container for up to 3 to 4 days.
